text.title: Can Olive Garden compete with the nation of Italy?
text.p: [Music]
Italy a nation of natural
beauty
arts and of course
food Americans including myself have a
very interesting relationship with this
country rather than a deep understanding
of its history it's become almost a
cartoonish export of food and
culture and due to immigration in the
early 1900s we have our own Italians
Chris qumo Frank Sinatra my dad the
rizzler is the rizzler Italian he's from
Jersey I think so that's like the same
thing right but when we're talking about
Italian restaurants in America there's
one that stands alone in not only its
success but its influence in the minds
of what americ Americans consider
Italian food to be that restaurant of
course is Olive
Garden but ask different people about
the restaurant and you'll get different
results some say that it's the
quintessential place for celebrating
birthdays graduations job
promotions others will describe it as a
gross misrepresentation of Italian food
and culture one big American company
parading around is an authentic Italian
Kitchen but has anyone ever been so
brave so unbelievably bold to go out of
their way to directly compare the two
what would a person look like that could
tackle such an important cultural
divide
well you're looking at him
[Music]
at the Olive Garden Italian restaurant
we speak a different language we have no
words for
can't and won't no phrases for a little
less in fact we don't know the meaning
of enough some would say speaking a
different language can make all the
difference in the world the olive
garding Italian restaurant where all the
best of Italy is yours there is no
better sale of the American dream than
the growth of a hole-in-the-wall
restaurant beloved by the community that
grows into an international sensation
people love a story that starts with a
humble family business that overcomes
adversity and is rewarded with riches
beyond their wildest imagination and the
Olive Garden Italian Kitchen is not that
story in 1982 General Mills the seral
company wait Cal company in 1982 General
Mills the company that made Cheerios was
fresh off of over a decade of success
from their acquire fired seafood
restaurant Red Lobster hold on Red
Lobster what if it's been a while since
you've eaten crab legs let Red Lobster
remind you how uhhuh right in the middle
that's right after years of success of
owning Red Lobster run by its original
owner Bill Darden General Mills had a
groundbreaking idea what if we did Red
Lobster but like Italian I guess the
Olive Garden Italian Kitchen was an
instant success with an advertising
Campa meant to convince the American
public that there was a fully authentic
Italian restaurant opening in their Town
impossible at the Olive Garden we don't
know the meaning of the word it's hot
it's summer Fantastico the Olive Garden
season of fun times and great food we
know speak it English we only from how
you say Orlando Florida so I will be
conducting the ultimate comparison of an
Americanized theme and the actual Source
it came from I will go to Olive Garden
then I will travel to the nation of
Italy adventuring from Naples to Capri
to Sicily then Rome Florence the tusin
countryside and Venice finally returning
to the land of Freedom Miller Light
speedboats house on Fox Dana White
freedom freedom freedom fre and then I
will go to Olive Garden one more time
for comparison in the suburbs of Chicago
when I'm home for the holidays also yes
before you ask this is my shirt and you
can buy it with other clothes at yank
shop.com God you're so embarrassing let
me live so before the trip to Italy I of
course had to go
too unlike the Olive Gardens I've seen
in the past this one looked considerably
less Italian instead of the standard
tusken Stone it looked like a bank with
the Olive Garden sign just slapped on it
hold on was this actually a bank
before yep okay unlike the somewhat
dying brands of my past Adventures this
Olive Garden was full of people and not
in a tourist area this was a
neighborhood spot that was just booked
and busy the decor inside felt less like
a tusen village and more like the home
of an American who's only a little
Italian but makes it their whole
identity unlike me someone who's only a
little Italian but it's it's like
different when I say it in America it's
really not about how Italian you are
it's about how loudly you claim to be as
we Rec seeded I immediately noticed that
the table came with its very own tablet
so your young child would never have to
spend a single second without the screen
my brother Tony then immediately started
playing Spider-Man but when I got a turn
I played the world famous app doggy dots
feels redundant to even explain because
we all of course know doggy dots but
it's a 101 dalmati themed card matching
game where you need to memorize which
cards are placed where to find its
matching oh not quite buddy but soon I
was sucked out of the digital world is
perhaps the most famous part of this
dinner arrived to our table Olive
gardens's unlimited bread sticks are a
staple of American chain restaurant
culture am I reading this right Olive
Garden passing out too many bread sticks
can you do that can you pass out too
many I don't think it's possible if
you're unaware if you finish the serving
of bread sticks at your table they just
keep bringing you more is this a
colossal waste of food yes is it perhaps
the most gluttonous restaurant practice
of all time the bread sticks came
wrapped and warm while I was eating
Chrissy kept attempting to stuff it back
so I would quote choke on that thing we
also ordered some fried lasagna that
actually surprised me in how much I
liked it for a drink I got something
that perfectly encapsulated the whole
vibe I gave off in the summer of 23 the
Italian Margarita and for my main course
I wanted something that would prepare me
for the experiences I was about to have
in Italy a true introduction to the
cuisine of the entire country lucky for
me there was a dish called the tour of
Italy our salad came with another round
of bread sticks but here's where the
Dilemma comes in I don't want to waste
food
so if I don't eat the bread sticks
they're going to throw them away but if
I do eat the bread sticks they'll just
bring more out but if don't eat the
bread sticks then then I waste the food
now as I was running my bread stick
calculations the waiter asked if we
wanted cheese grated on the salad but
didn't tell us to say when when we
wanted them to stop we realized that one
of us needed to speak up but by the time
we did there was already too much
Che my bad after too many bread bread
sticks a Cheesy salad and a very sugary
Margarita I was hoping my entree would
be a somewhat lighter
pasta oh no the tour of Italy was a
chicken parm fetuccini Alfredo and
lasagna all on one plate so with a
nearly full stomach I decided to dive in
now Olive Gardens fetuccini Alfredo is
one of the most ordered pasta dishes in
the United States and I've actually
never tried before but while recording
my first bite I was unaware that I
accidentally filmed it in slow
motion actually never had their
maybe it's just this plate but I don't
know man fetuccini Alfredo is just not
for me I suspect that it's because when
I was a kid I watched that episode of
The Office where Michael eats an entire
bowl of fetuccini Alfredo and then runs
a 5k right after so whenever I taste the
kind of heavy creamy Rich bits of the
pasta I just picture running a marathon
and getting sick and you know if that's
your favorite pasta maybe you'll think
of that now too maybe I ruined it for
you wouldn't that be something that com
combined with the chicken parm and
lasagna which were both very mediocre I
along with everyone at the table was
stuffed one thing to point out as well
as I paid the check is that Olive Garden
isn't cheap sure the portions are huge
but compared to more quality Italian
restaurants 19 to $24 for a plate of
pasta is pretty pricey stuffed to the
brim I still managed to polish off one
last bread stick quickly on our way out
before they could give us more and just
like that our authentic Italian night
out was coming to an end did you get it
yeah I got it it looks like I'm holding
up the side yeah it looks like yeah I
got
it you sure you sure it looks right so a
trip to Olive Garden was checked off the
list and next up I had to go to Italy
all right it is 2: a.m. before we head
to the airport at 3:40 I was out of
laundry and cold so I threw this on and
now it looks like I'm about to grade a
bunch of papers on to Killa Mockingbird
you know I said that thinking like haha
what if I looked like an Old English
teacher but I am now the appropriate age
for an English teacher
so I just the jok's on me I don't even
have a real job and they do preparing
for this trip was very new to me I've
never been to Europe and other than
Canada I haven't even been outside the
country before growing up family
vacations consisted of packing up the
car and driving up to Wisconsin to hang
out near a lake or camping in in
Michigan to hang out near a bigger Lake
while I've been around most of the
states now thanks to my job I'm a pretty
uncultured American what do you mean the
outlets are different why do they have
different holes and Italy to the
Italians in my family has floated around
as this dream vacation somewhere we
could never afford to go but maybe one
day we would so it's a fitting
destination for my first trip overseas
we had a lot of time to waste on both
flights so I decided to watch one of the
most famous triple features of all time
civil camra hole where you start with
Civil War by Alex Garland cleanse your
pallet with Josh O Connor of Challengers
Fame in loima then finish it off with a
viewing of Disney's holes I watched
through Civil War but aside from that
the first flight to JFK wasn't too
eventful I got this blanket I used the
high-tech toilet
and soon we were in New York with a
2-hour layover then back on a plane
again for my first ever overseas flight
it had now been around 30 hours since I
had any sleep so it would make sense for
my body to finally allow me to sleep on
a plane for the first time in my life
we'll be landing at 9:00 a.m. in Naples
so I desperately needed some shy before
a full day in Italy lucky for me after
20 28 years on this Earth I finally fell
asleep on a plane for 10 minutes so I
watched holes instead now I've been on
many flights mostly between LA and
Chicago but never one that served a meal
so I've never been able to answer the
age-old question what's the deal with
airplane food the food was actually not
bad even though it looks awful on camera
here and this flight had a much simpler
toilet system with very clear directions
for those like me who are easily
confused oh okay soon the sun rose on
what would become my third calendar day
without more than 10 minutes of sleep
after 15 hours of travel and nearly zero
sleep the plane descended on a
completely flat Earth we had made it to
Italy
[Music]
oh I forgot to mention that our friends
Drew and Amanda came too so the four of
us were ready to explore a new country
my first time traveling internationally
other than Canada which doesn't really
count wow I'm brimming with excitement
over what could be different
here Italy make room for one more white
boy oh look it's an Italian doll
I wonder if he has an
accent everything is so incredibly new
to my Midwestern American
eyes local
shops Italian
coffee
[Music]
Sephora
hi I haven't slept in three
[Music]
days we landed at 9:00 a.m. and to keep
from destroying our sleep schedules for
most of the trip we decided to stay up
until 6:00 p.m. keep in mind that I
skipped sleeping a few hours the night
before the flight and didn't get any
sleep on the plane so by midday I had
been up for over 40 hours straight
exploring the city felt like I was in
some weird dream walking in the heat in
a city that felt unfamiliar to me with
One Singular Mission keeping us awake
when it comes to food Naples is famous
around the world for its signature dish
pizza there is a particular type of
pizza snobbery that Naples flaunts to
the rest of the world as the proclaimed
inventors of modern pizza there is a
specific and certified way to do it but
being weird about pizza isn't exclusive
to Naples or or even Italy as a whole
it's simple if Italians lived in your
city wherever you're from whatever your
pizza looks like your pizza is the best
pizza are you from New Haven Connecticut
I can't believe that people claim that

come on you guys are great from New York
I I mean obviously you guys have the

from Chicago eat that deep dish
by the way people who think that deep
dish is the main pizza in Chicago you
are absolutely correct it's actually
illegal to cook a thin crust pizza in
Cook County when deciding on where we
were going to get our neapolitan pizza
the one and only real Pizza we were
stuck deciding between two choices one

as of recent history that parading

and he can also play the saxophone so of
course we went with the other option
damn If Only They had Liz Cheney there
too maybe I would have gone all four of

kept me awake and alert would it be

well this is what the pizza looked like

number
one okay now number

back back

what the hell it's
this what the okay it looks like that is

ghost doll the pizza was very good I've
had similar Neapolitan style pizza in
the US but none were this thin and like
wet but not in a bad way like the dough
is so thin it almost feels more like
you're eating pasta with red sauce and
cheese than it does eating an American
slice I don't think I've ever had
Neapolitan style pizza in the US that is
quite like this so they were right to be
snobby but was this a pizza that put the
US to shame honestly not even close this
is just another type of great pizza to
me was it better than anything I had
from Olive Garden Yeah by a mile at this
point i' had been up for 48 hours and I
do not remember what happened after the

and I know that I slept but even though
it was delirious it was a great first
day in a new
country I know it's only 600 p.m. but
good night Naples tomorrow we're headed

to we were taking a boat in the morning

this is not me recommending to wake up

into looking at some stairs as a

knows that about me but one thing about
Italian cities that I can't get over is
how much food there is and how easy it
is to access thousands of shops that let
you just walk right up have food in your
hand in a few seconds and on top of all
that like everything we've eaten here
has been way cheaper than the US and I
understand I live in Los Angeles where
in some areas everything costs $1,000
but I've been around the country I'm not
even from here I know what costs
but after barely getting any sleep on
the train and a full day out in the sun
elbowing through crowds of tourists it
was time for my daily run my jog in Rome
was slow and Delirious I don't like to
run near crowds so I found a side street
to do laps on the problem was that it
was very Steep and had a really uneven
pavement tired and out of it I ran up
then down then up and down down again at
one point I thought I should maybe put
my phone away and focus on my footing
but seconds
later
[Music]
disaster somebody come
[Music]
quick my worst nightmare had become a
reality I fell and scraped my knee my
foot caught a very uneven piece of
cobblestone and I ate in front of
two two elderly Italian women walking a
dog I hit the ground so hard that I slid
a couple of inches on the Cobblestone I
was so embarrassed that before I could
even feel the pain I shot up grabbed my
phone off the ground and sprinted around
the
corner ow later that night we walked on
over to meet up with our group for a
food tour we signed up for now I know a
food tour tour sounds like the most
touristy thing you can do but this
actually ended up being the night that I
felt the least like a tourist our tour
guide was from Rome and accompanied each
stop with background on the city each
restaurant and Italy as a whole and the
reason I felt less like a tourist is
because you'll never get to know a place
better than talking to somebody who
actually grew up there spending an
entire night hearing completely new
stories about this country and its food
hit me like a truck sorry I forgot we
were in Europe hit me like a fainty
little bike in my walkable City none of
this history resembled what I learned in
school was there more to Italy than
being the henchmen of World War II while
some Italians came to the US to make
pizzas how could history be happening if
America wasn't involved could there
possibly be things that have happened in
the world that we have nothing to do
with the implications were unsettling to
say the least but after tonight one
thing is clear true Italian authenticity
is impossible possible to recreate
anywhere other than Italy itself there's
just too much history behind every dish
so much so that certain regions of Italy
have a true claim on specific Foods
carbonara in a place outside of Rome
quote isn't real carbonara but this is
